moves.1. e4: King pawn opening; White seizes control over the center with this strong move
moves.2. Nf3: White develops his knight while attacking my pawn.
moves.2... Nc6: I activate mine and I protect my e pawn
moves.3. Bc4: Italian opening; white attacks my weak f7 pawn
moves.3... Nf6: I opt for the two knight defense. Pretty much normal so far
moves.4. Ng5: White attacks my weak f7 pawn again, and I can't protect it properly
moves.4... Bc5: Since I got bad results playing d4 here, I decided to play the agressive traxler variation.
moves.5... Bxf2+: I sac my bishop to bring the white king out in the open.
moves.6... Nxe4+: Checking the king while taking a pawn
moves.7. Ke3: ?! Now both my queen and knight are attacked, so...
moves.7... Qh4: This move gets my queen out of the knight's attack and protects mine
moves.8. g3: ! Now I must lose a piece, as I can't protect my knight anymore
moves.8... Nxg3: So I just sacced it to rip open white king's position
moves.9... Qd4+: The best move here, as I keep the initiative
moves.10. Kf3: Ke2 fails to Qxc4+ followed by Qxf7
moves.10... d5: ! Attacks the white bishop while treatening Bg4+, winning the queen
moves.11. Nxe5: ?? Although I didn't see it when I played this game, this move is met by Rf8+ (or 0-0+), which  is mate in 2 after 12. Nf7 Rxf7+ 13. Kg2 Qf2# or 13. Ke2 Qe4#
moves.11... Nxe5+: ? I give this move a question mark because I missed the mate, but it would have been less interesting.
moves.12. Kg2: Ke2 is still met by Bg4+, winning the queen.
moves.12... Bg4: I wonder if this was the best move. Any suggestions, readers? In any case, I develop my bishop and attack the white queen
moves.13. Qe1: white gets his queen out of the way while pinning my knight. good move
moves.13... dxc4: Why not? White has no Immediate threats, I restore material equality and I have a crushing positionnal advantage. Just look at white undevelopped queenside!
moves.14. Rh4: ? Pins the bishop to my queen, but nothing much else
moves.14... O-O: !! I activate my rook into the deadly fully open f file AND I unpin my knight
moves.15. c3: ?? Loses the game in a pretty way. Nc3 is better here
moves.15... Qd5+: !! Did you noticed that the white king is trapped in a 2x2 square box? Forced mate in 3
moves.16. Kh2: ?? Although every moves here loses, white has chosen the most painful way to lose
moves.16... Nf3+: ! My opponent actually resigned here at this nice royal fork, but the next moves shows how I would have finished the game
moves.17. Kg2: The king is forced to go in the h1-a8 diagonal...
moves.17... Nxe1+: I take his queen, with a double check
moves.18. Kh2 Nf3+: The white king must go into the h1-a8 diagonal AGAIN!
moves.19. Kh1 Nxh4+: I take his rook, with a discovered check
moves.20. Kg1 Qg2#:
0-1  For those who wondered, if the king tries to escape through the f file, he would have been mated quick enough by Nxh4+ Ke1 Rae8#, activating my other rook as well.
